contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2012}} {{unreferenced|date=June 2012}} {{Infobox flag |Name = Nauru |Article = |Nickname = |Image = Flag of Nauru.svg |Image_size = 250px |Imagetext= Flag of Nauru | Use = 010100 | Symbol = | Proportion = 1:2 | Adoption = 31 January 1968 | Design = }} Following the [[declaration of independence|indepencence]] of [[Nauru]], the '''flag of Nauru''' was raised for the first time. The flag, chosen in a local design competition, was adopted on independence day, 31 January 1968. It depicts Nauru's geographical position, one degree below the [[Equator]]. A gold horizontal stripe representing the Equator runs across a blue field for the Pacific Ocean. Nauru itself is symbolized by a white 12-pointed star. Each point represents one of the 12 indigenous tribes on the island. ==Proportions and symbolism== The flag displays the geographical location of the [[island nation]]. The narrow yellow stripe with a width of <sup>1</sup>/<sub>24</sub> of the length of the flag represents the [[Equator]]. The twelve-pointed white star signifies the location of the island in the blue waters of the [[Pacific Ocean]] just south of the Equator. The separation of the blue flag cloth into two equal parts recalls the [[saga]], that the first inhabitants were to have been brought to Earth from two boulders. The twelve points on the star represent the island's twelve original tribes. The white represents the [[phosphate]], through which the island's residents acquired wealth from mining. ==Creation and adoption== The flag was created by a resident employed by the [[Australia]]n flag manufacturer Evans. It was officially adopted on 31 January 1968. Unlike some flags of [[Pacific]] nations (e.g., that of [[Flag of Tuvalu|Tuvalu]]), [[Nauru]]'s flag has evoked little controversy. ==Flag variant used by Scouts== A variant of the Flag of [[Nauru]] is used by [[Scouts]] locally. ==Historic Flag of Nauru== <gallery> File:Flag of the United Kingdom.svg|[[File:FIAV historical.svg|23px]] Flag of Nauru used during [[League of Nations Mandate|Mandate]] with [[United Kingdom]] and [[Australia]] 1919-1948.
